item.title: Video Shows Israeli Extremists Celebrating Palestinian Child’s Death
item.description: Officials said they were investigating the video, taken at a wedding. Guests there appeared to be cheering the death of 18-month-old Ali Dawabsheh.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID

item.title: Iraqis’ Arrest in Finland Highlights Difficulties in Prosecuting Distant Crimes
item.description: Two men have been held in an ISIS massacre in Tikrit, based on a video, but even when authorities have such evidence, it’s a challenge to hold suspects accountable for atrocities.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: A suspect, center, at a courthouse in Tampere, Finland, this month. He is believed to be one of the Iraqi twin brothers implicated in a massacre near Tikrit, Iraq, in June 2014.

item.title: ISIS Claims Major Counterattacks as Iraqi Forces Lay Siege to Ramadi
item.description: The Islamic State said it completed deadly strikes in response to a military assault to retake Ramadi, though Iraqi officials denied they suffered major casualties.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Fire in Saudi Hospital’s Maternity Ward and I.C.U. Kills 25
item.description: The authorities were investigating the cause of the blaze in Jizan, which also injured more than 100, in the third mass calamity to hit the desert kingdom in the past four months.
item.dc:creator: MONA BOSHNAQ
item.media:description: There was extensive damage at the general hospital in Jizan, Saudi Arabia, after a fire broke out Thursday.

item.title: In a Torn West Bank, Christians Tone Down Holiday Celebrations
item.description: Violence and upheaval have overwhelmed the holiday season, making it hard to offer public expressions of cheer across the West Bank.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID and RAMI NAZZAL
item.media:description: A Palestinian man sold cotton candy near the Church of the Nativity in the West Bank city of Bethlehem on Wednesday.

item.title: Fernande Grudet, ‘Madame Claude’ Who Ran High-Society Call-Girl Ring, Dies at 92
item.description: In her heyday, Madame Claude presided over 500 women she called her swans; she claimed her clients included John F. Kennedy and the shah of Iran.
item.dc:creator: WILLIAM GRIMES
item.media:description: Fernande Grudet, better known as Madame Claude, in Paris before appearing on a television talk show in 1986.

item.title: Debate Over Cecil Rhodes Statue at Oxford Gains Steam
item.description: A monument has inspired a petition and protests, along with a vigorous discussion about whether Britain’s colonial past should be judged by contemporary standards.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:description: The statue of Cecil Rhodes was removed from the University of Cape Town in April. At Oxford University, a petition and campaign to remove a similar monument to Rhodes has gained ground.

item.title: Ninth Person Is Detained in Belgium Over Paris Attacks
item.description: A 30-year-old Belgian who communicated with a cousin of the man who planned the assaults has been held on murder and terrorism charges.
item.dc:creator: SEWELL CHAN and MILAN SCHREUER
item.media:description: King Philippe of Belgium delivering his annual Christmas message at the Royal Palace in Brussels.

item.title: Fire in Saudi Hospital’s Maternity Ward and I.C.U. Kills Dozens
item.description: An overnight fire at a hospital in the southwestern Saudi province of Jizan killed at least 31 people and injured over 100, the Saudi government said.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: Members of the Saudi civil defense agency outside a hospital in the port city of Jazan, Saudi Arabia, after a fire on Thursday.

item.title: Bulgarian Border Police Accused of Abusing Refugees
item.description: Interviews with aid workers and dozens of refugees revealed a widespread fear of the authorities. But it is not known how common abuse is.
item.category: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
item.dc:creator: RICK LYMAN
item.media:credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
item.media:description: Workers expanding a border fence on the outskirts of the small Bulgarian village of Lesovo this month. Refugees have reported being beaten and robbed by Bulgarian border guards while crossing from Turkey.

item.title: Americans Held Hostage in Iran Win Compensation 36 Years Later
item.description: Buried in the omnibus spending bill signed into law last week are provisions to give each of the former hostages or their estates up to $4.4 million.
item.dc:creator: DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:description: One of the American hostages was shown to a crowd outside the United States Embassy in Tehran in November 1979.

item.title: Sinosphere: Hiding in Plain Sight as Beijing Disappears Into Blanket of Smog
item.description: The artist Liu Biolin said his new work was inspired by the red alerts issued in the city this month for hazardous levels of air pollution.
item.dc:creator: VANESSA PIAO
item.media:description: Liu Bolin, right, during the making of “Winter Solstice.”

item.title: Sinosphere: Embassies in Beijing Warn of Possible Threats Against Foreigners
item.description: The warnings focused on the Sanlitun shopping district on or around Christmas Day, and urged citizens to “exercise heightened vigilance.”
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: The paramilitary police guarding a mall in the Sanlitun area of Beijing on Thursday, as the embassies of the United States and other countries warned of possible threats against Westerners over Christmas.

item.title: Tlalpujahua Journal: A Christmas Economy Thrives All Year in the Mountains of Mexico
item.description: Tourists come from across Mexico and the world to the small village of Tlalpujahua, known for its festive glass ornaments hand-crafted by local artisans.
item.dc:creator: AZAM AHMED
item.media:credit: Rodrigo Cruz for The New York Times
item.media:description: A woman painted Christmas ornaments at a workshop in Tlalpujahua, Mexico. Though high season is October to December, production of the handmade ornaments takes place all year.

item.title: 2 Sentenced to Death in Killing of British Tourists in Thailand
item.description: Two men from Myanmar, both workers on a popular resort island, were convicted of murder, rape and unlawful entry into the country.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS FULLER
item.media:description: U Win Zaw Htun, center left, and U Zaw Lin, center right, shown in July, were convicted on Thursday of murder, rape and unlawful entry into Thailand.

item.title: Fire in Saudi Hospital’s Maternity Ward and I.C.U. Kills Dozens
item.description: A predawn fire at a hospital in the southwestern port city of Jazan killed 25 people and injured 107, the Saudi civil defense agency said.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS
item.media:description: Members of the Saudi civil defense agency outside a hospital in the port city of Jazan, Saudi Arabia, after a fire on Thursday.

item.title: Ex-News Executive in China Gets 4-Year Sentence for Extortion
item.description: A Shanghai court found that Shen Hao, the former chairman of 21st Century Media, had demanded advertising purchases from businesses in exchange for positive coverage.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: World Briefing: Thailand: 2 Sentenced to Death for Murders of British Tourists
item.description: The verdict follows an investigation and trial that were mired in controversy, including allegations of police incompetence, mishandling of evidence and torture of the suspects.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Saudi Arabia: Condemned Maid Spared From Death Sentence
item.description: An appeals court has commuted a sentence of death by stoning for a Sri Lankan woman convicted of adultery.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Venezuela’s Departing Legislature Approves 13 New Justices
item.description: The legislature, dominated by President Nicolás Maduro’s party, voted in what critics called an attempt to stack the Supreme Court in the executive branch’s favor before an opposition-dominated Assembly took over.
item.dc:creator: PATRICIA TORRES and WILLIAM NEUMAN
